name: Ahtna
description: The Ahtna sky culture is the result of fieldwork with Northern Dene peoples, investigating how they conceptualize and integrate the sky into systems of knowledge, practices, cosmology, and spirituality. Characteristic is a principal constellation: the incarnated spirit of a Traveler figure who circled the world in Distant Time.

names.english: That Which Moves Over the Earth
That Which Moves in a Circle Following Us
The One Who Went Around the Edge of the World
The One Who Went Around the Edge of the Water/Ocean
The One Who Leads Us Ahead

constellations.certainty: Most stars are identified, and a pictograph is drawn in the source [cannon2021northerndene]. The line figure here follows the star path of each body part listed, connecting them. His kidney is an unidentified star near the cup of the Big Dipper (not included here). His right hand is 'two unidentified stars in Cassiopeia': the two closest stars are added here. The eyes (bet Tau, iot Aur) and heart (27 Lyn) are unconnected. It is not clear whether the abdomen should be delineated from the head with a neckline (bet Aur, alf Gem); that line is drawn here.
constellations.description: This is a meta-, whole-sky constellation; the individual body parts are explicitly separated in a table as asterisms. In local tradition, Nek’eltaeni was the first being to appear among the stars. Before going to the sky, he was the culture hero and Traveler figure known as Yabaaghe Tezyaann ('the one who went around the edge of the world') (and other similar names in Ahtna dialects), who transformed an archaic animal people into the present-day distinct animal species, and established peace and order on earth. He uses medicine power and is a model of compassion. Nek’eltaeni is a large man-animal or therianthrope figure composed of at least 18 asterisms named using body part terms. He wears a backpack (native: ughaele') and holds a walking stick/weapon/medicine staff (native: utets) in his left hand. The Milky Way is his trail (native: utene). His representation as a therianthrope or shapeshifter recalls ancient time when humans and animals were one.
Orion's belt. The stars were used for timing seasonal hunting activities.
